content: this is a summary of a legal text regarding a family court case that has been ongoing for 2 years and 6 months the case involves a married couple and their property the court ruled that gifts given to one spouse by their parents are considered the individual property of that spouse unless stated otherwise it also determined that if one coowner of a property cannot use it they are entitled to an occupancy allowance the court considered the closest date to the partition when valuing the assets for division claims for compensation for unauthorized work on the property were rejected and the valuation of vehicles in the event of a divorce was clarified the judgment dismissed unfounded claims included specific liabilities in the liquidation statement and ordered the provisional enforcement of the decision pending an appeal the legal principles used in the decision were outlined in various articles of the civil code the wife requested a reward for a gift made by the husbands mother an occupancy allowance for a property owned by the husbands parents and compensation for work done on a property owned by the husband the husband requested approval of a report and continuation of the liquidation process the court ruled on each request dismissing some and granting others the text also discusses the legal basis for these claims and the arguments made by both parties the issue of valuing vehicles owned by the couple and the classification of gifts made by parents are also mentioned
